captions.text:
Push your Minecraft Redstone Handbook aside
to make room in your Watch Dogs backpack because
I'm Jake and this is episode #24 of Game LÜT

Say goodmorning to your DOTA Shagbark Plush,
fluff that Super Mario Thwomp Pillow and pull

yourself out of this awesome Snorlax Bed.
Then battle the day with a Titanfall hoodie

and Starfox T-shirt. You could always do a
barrel roll in your 3D Printed Faster Than

Light ship. Before leaving the house, secure
it using a Grand Theft Auto Safe Lock magnet

If you're feeling super, save the world and
some time with Justice League watches and

soldier on in a classy leather Captain America
Jacket. When you're done wipe those dirty

feet on Dragon Quest floor mats that come
in a variety of designs. And use Mario Paper

Weights to hold down these prints by artist
Louis Loskosch...

Create a Mass Effect with a N7 eye makeup
set from GeekChic or try the Companion Cube

shade to go with those Portal leggings and
Tank top and finish the look with Mortal Kombat

Earrings. If you want to hide your face there's
a welders mask from BioShock 2. Create a web

of genres with a spiderman tank, rebel alliance
wooden necklace and some limited edition Famicom
pins.

After dressing yourself, dress your apple
tv with a retro super nintendo decal. Keep

that old school vibe alive with one of these
classic console usb controllers that comes

in atari, gamecube, genesis, n64, NES, and
SNES.

If you wanna be really retro then drop $5,000
on a Vintage Zelda Belt buckle. Or you could

just throw your money away in a DIY Claptrap
trashcan and use whatever is left to get this
really great looking Link Wind Waker figure...

Now I have something important to ask you
and I hope you don't have any objection...tshirt

but will you be my companion ring set? There
are ones for mario and luigi, batman and robin,
and link & zelda.

You can hide your feelings by wearing a camo
metal gear solid t-shirt. If we fallout you
can keep my vault 101 track jacket.

And I'll keep these light up BioShock EVE
syringes, the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle

pint glasses and stare at some delightfully
dissected mario characters by Jude buffum

If you're into graphic novels there's Pullist,
a subscription service that sends you a different

graphic novel every month. I was actually
asked to be the guest curator for the month

of May and I'm super excited because I've
been using the service for awhile, they don't

even know I'm giving them a shout out right
now - Hello Pullist, I'll take all the subscriptions...for

free - but it is really awesome. Like this
month's pick, Elektra, is insanely good. So

if you want to see and read what my choice
is for May, go check out pullist, link in

the description, and as always, thanks for
watching.
